title: Attend a Wine Tasting Class at the Culinary Institute of America
long_description:
Exceptional wine and delicious cuisine brings millions of people to Napa Valley each year. What if you could hone valley wine and culinary skills of your own to take with you from your visit? Now you can.

The Culinary Institute of America at Greystone in the town of St. Helena offers one-hour Tasting Bar classes every Saturday to help you enhance your wine tasting techniques. These informal and informative classes are designed to help you refine your palate with the flavors of the grape and its culinary accompaniments.

Experiment and evaluate the flavor and texture of local artisanal cheese in the Wine and Cheese class and learn how to pair with wines from the valley. Take the Wine and Olive Oil workshop and learn the intertwined history of olives and grapes found planted together across the globe which both offer a spectrum of enticing and complimentary flavors. For something sweet, try the Wine and Chocolate class to create flavor combinations that balance the bitterness, sweetness, and intensity of wine with confections made by CIA at Greystone’s own chocolatier.

For the fundamentals of wine, the Calibrate Your Wine Palate class helps you taste and smell like a pro. Learn important wine attributes and apply professional techniques when tasting. When you have your whites to reds to rosés figured out, try the All That Sparkles class. Learn all there is to know about sparkling wine, from history, creation, glassware, and aging, to what professionals look for when evaluating a glass of bubbly.

Enroll in a Saturday class today for only $45. Tickets can be purchased in advance or on the day of. Visit the CIA Class Calendar for a full schedule of upcoming classes. 

For more CIA Greystone experiences, enroll in a food or wine Boot Camp, or dine at one of their chic eateries for cuisine and confections created by CIA students.

--

Want to take your wine knowledge to the next level? Enroll in a Culinary Institute of America wine tasting class and book your stay with the Wine Country Inn, a romantic and secluded boutique hotel only minutes from the Greystone campus.
